Click on each apparatus/reagent to know its name or click on “Continue” to start the experiment.
Label 6 test tubes (of 15ml each) as shown.
Take the first test tube and label it as "Blank".
Label the second test tube as "0.2".
Label the third test tube as "0.4".
Similarly label the other test tubes also as shown.
Take a 1000 micro litres pipette and set its volume to 200 micro litres.
Take an appropriate tip.
Now, take the prepared standard maltose solution using the micro pipette.
Pour 0.2ml of maltose solution to the test tube labelled "0.2".
Repeat the same procedure for the rest of the test tubes according to the labelled measurement, except the test tube labelled “Blank”.
Take some distilled water in a measuring jar.
Take 2000 micro litres pipette and set its volume to 2000 micro litres (2 ml).
Pipette in the distilled water from the measuring jar.
Pour it into the test tube labelled "Blank".
Take 2000 micro litres pipette and set its volume to 1800 micro litres.
Pipette in the distilled water from the measuring jar.
Similarly pour 1.8ml of the distilled water to the test tube labelled "0.2" to make it 2ml.
Repeat the same procedure for the rest of the test tubes with the corresponding measurement to make it 2ml.
Now all the test tubes are of equal volume (2 ml).
Set the volume of the pipette to 1000 micro litres (1ml).
Change the tip of the pipette.
Take prepared DNS reagent using the pipette from its bottle.
Pour it into the test tube labelled,"Blank".
Similarly pour 1ml each of DNS reagents into all the other test tubes.
We can observe that all the test tubes are of equal volume (3 ml).
Cover the mouths of all the test tubes with an aluminium foil as shown.
Take all the test tubes including rack.
Keep it in a water bath.
Keep it for 5 minutes at 100°C.
As time passes, the colour of the solution in each test tube kept in water bath will change.
Now take out the test tubes from the water bath.
Keep it in cold water for few minutes to cool the test tubes.
Observe the change in the colour of the solution in each test tube.
Pour some distilled water in a measuring jar.
Take 9 ml of distilled water using a pipette.
Pour it into the test tube labelled,"Blank" and mix it well with pipette as shown.
Take a new pipette and fix it with a pump.
Similarly pour 9 ml of distilled water in each test tube and mix it well.
Now all the test tubes are of equal volume (12 ml).
Change the tip of the pipette.
Take 1 ml of the solution from the test tube labelled, "Blank".
Pour the solution into a cuvette till the specified mark.
Wipe the surface of the cuvette with a tissue paper. (Never put wet tubes in colorimeter.)
Adjust the wavelength of the colorimeter to 540nm and place the cuvette on the slot of the colorimeter. (Do not touch the body of the cuvette.)
Set the colorimeter value to zero as shown.
Now, take out the cuvette from the colorimeter.
Similarly take 1 ml from the first test tube.
Pour it into an another cuvette.
Keep it in the colorimeter. Note the value.
Repeat the same procedure for the rest of the test tubes.
Now plot the graph, OD at 540nm Vs Amount of Maltose in mg. We get a straight line.
